title: Chat filter is enabled in-Game
body:
After updating league and while playing a game, I saw that the language filter was on. After the game I wanted to disable it, but turns out it's un-checked, so it was already disabled. Couldn't find a chat filter disable in the In-Game options. Tried to repair and un-check the Filter again, but it doesn't work.
I also went to my preferences in the air client folder and the chatfilter= 0. 
Is this a 7.3 bug or is it just me?

replies.body:
Yep I am having the same issue and i tried the

Your toggle may be having an issue saving. The following workaround was able to help some players, so let me know if it works for you:

Close League of Legends
Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases(lat est version)\deploy\preferences
Open up the shared(summoner name).PROPERTIES file up with Notepad
It should say:
[Chat]
EnableChatFilter=1
Just change the 1 to a 0. Hit Ctrl+S to save it.

Hey there! I don't know if you solved your problem yet but I just fished around in my files and fixed it for myself! Try this!

Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config\PersistedSettings
Look for: {
                            "name": "EnableChatFilter",
                            "value": "0"
                        }
Change the "1" to a "0" and change nothing else.

Also another thing I did was I went to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config\game ... scrolled to the bottom and changed [Chat]
EnableChatFilter=1 from a 1 to a 0.

Let me know if this helped :)
